_field_tag_reference.name: Init sound bank#Init sound bank for WWise.
Global sound bank#Global sound bank for WWise.
Extra sound bank#The other sound bank for WWise.
Campaign sound bank#Extra sound bank for WWise - only loaded for Campaign.
Multiplayer sound bank#Extra sound bank for WWise - only loaded for MP - PVP.

_field_string.name: Streaming pck file#Name of the stream pack file

plugin._field_explanation: I have moved the ai globals out of this tag, and into its own tag which is referenced here.

_field_block.name: DEPRECATED{ai globals}*!

_field_real.name: AI infantry-on-AI weapon damage scale:[0,1]#Global scale on weapon damage made by AI on other AI
AI vehicle-on-AI weapon damage scale:[0,1]#Global scale on weapon damage made by AI in a vehicle on other AI
AI player vehicle-on-AI weapon damage scale:[0,1]#Global scale on weapon damage made by AI in a vehicle with the player on other AI
danger broadly facing
danger shooting near
danger shooting at
danger extremely close
danger shield damage
danger exetended shield damage
danger body damage
danger extended body damage
jump down:wu/tick
jump step:wu/tick
jump crouch:wu/tick
jump stand:wu/tick
jump storey:wu/tick
jump tower:wu/tick
max jump down height down:wu
max jump down height step:wu
max jump down height crouch:wu
max jump down height stand:wu
max jump down height storey:wu
max jump down height tower:wu

_field_block._field_explanation: The maximum ranges to which firing point evaluations will do pathfinding searches. INCREASING THESE VALUES WILL ALMOST CERTAINLY HAVE A NEGATIVE IMPACT ON PERFORMANCE.

_field_real.name: search range infantry:wus
search range flying:wus
search range vehicle:wus
search range giant:wus
min retreat time:secs
ideal retreat time:secs
max retreat time:secs
scary target threhold#A target of this scariness is offically considered scary (by combat dialogue, etc.)
scary weapon threhold#A weapon of this scariness is offically considered scary (by combat dialogue, etc.)
player scariness
berserking actor scariness
kamikazeing actor scariness
invincible scariness#when an actor's target is invincible, he is this much more scared

_field_block._field_explanation: A few properties to help define when it is safe for a mission critical character to ressurect.

_field_real.name: min death time:seconds#I will be dead for at least this long
projectile distance:wu#If there is a projectile within this distance of me, I'll stay dead
idle clump distance:wu#If there is any enemy clump within this distance of me, I'll stay dead
dangerous clump distance:wu#If there is any enemy clump with a status higher than idle within this distance of me, I'll stay dead

_field_block._field_explanation: A few properties to help define when it is safe for a mission critical character to teleport.

_field_real.name: cover search duration:seconds#The number of seconds that must elapse before we try to look for a firing point behind cover to teleport to.
task direction search duration:seconds#The number of seconds we try to look for a firing point that aligns us with the actor's task direction.
radius

_field_block._field_explanation: Some values to help you control how much guys will throttle when they want to stick with the rest of their squad.

_field_real.name: stop dist:wu#At this distance from the squad, stop.
resume dist:wu#At this distance from the squad, start again.
min dist:wu#Start throttling back at this distance
max dist:wu#Maximum trottle scale at this distance
min scale:0-1#Minimum throttle value.

_field_block._field_explanation: Parameters related to squad patrolling.

_field_real.name: passthrough chance#Chance of passing through a patrol objective without pausing
search phase skip chance#Chance of skipping the search phase when stopped at a patrol objective
patrol transition timeout:seconds#If the squad takes more than this time to get to their new patrol point, cancel it and go on to the next.
patrol maneuver timeout:seconds#If the squad takes longer than this time to reposition within a patrol point (e.g. searching and pausing), cancel the point and go on to the next.

_field_real_bounds.name: patrol search firing point time:seconds#spend this amount of time at a search firing position when in search phase

_field_real.name: patrol isolation distance:wus#If you are more than this distance from your nearest squadmate, you are officially isolated.
patrol isolation time:seconds#If you are isolated for more than this time, you get deleted.

_field_block._field_explanation: These parameters control how the kung-fu circle works (i.e. when tasks have kungfu-count associated with them)

_field_real.name: kungfu deactivation delay:seconds#When a task is disallowed from shooting, turn it off after this delay

_field_custom.name: Presearch Child Counts (0 means no limit)

_field_block.name: vision traits
_field_block._field_explanation: Traits that affect the AI's vision

_field_real.name: vision distance scale#Scale the distance at which an AI can see their target.
vision angle scale#Scale the angles of the AI's vision cone.

_field_block.name: sound traits
_field_block._field_explanation: Traits that affect the AI's sound awareness

_field_real.name: hearing distance scale#Scale the character's hearing distance.

_field_block.name: luck traits
_field_block._field_explanation: Traits that affect the AI's luck

_field_real.name: evasion chance scale#Scale the chance of evading fire.
grenade dive chance scale#Scale the chance of diving from grenades.
broken kamikaze chance scale#Scale the chance of going kamikaze when broken.
leader dead retreat chance scale#Scale the chance of retreating when your leader dies.
dive retreat chance scale#Scale the chance of retreating after a dive.
shield depleted berserk chance scale#Scale the chance of berserking when your shield is depleted.
leader abandoned berserk chance scale#Scale the chance of a leader berserking when all his followers die.
melee attack delay timer scale#Scale the time between melee attacks.
melee chance scale#Scale the chance of meleeing.
melee leap delay timer scale#Scale the delay for performing melee leaps.
throw grenade delay scale#Scale the time between grenade throws.

_field_block.name: grenade traits
_field_block._field_explanation: Traits that affect the AI's grenade use

_field_real.name: velocity scale#Scale the velocity at which AI throws grenades
throw grenade delay scale#Scale the time between grenade throws.
don't drop grenades chance scale
grenade uncover chance scale
retreat throw grenade chance scale
anti vehicle grenade chance scale
throw grenade chance scale
max decay time
decay time ping
search pattern radius

_field_short_integer_bounds.name: search pattern cells per shell range

_field_real.name: damage multiplier
field of view:degrees
yaw scale
pitch scale
forward scale
side scale
up scale
transition time:seconds#time it takes for the camera to move from the initial distance to the final distance
falling death transition time:seconds#time it takes for the camera to move to its final position during a falling death
initial distance:wu#on the first frame after death, this is how far out of the body the camera will be
final distance:wu#how far from the body the camera will settle
dead cam z offset:wu#how far above the body the camera focuses on
dead cam maximum elevation:radians#the highest angle the camera can raise to (prevents it from flipping over the vertical axis)
dead cam movement delay:seconds#delay in tracking the killer
time_to_auto_switch_to_orbiting:seconds#how long the death camera lasts before auto-switching to orbiting camera
ignore_stick_time:seconds#how long the death camera ignores stick inputs and keeps turning towards the killer (should be non-zero because user could have died while running or looking around)
ignore_button_time:seconds#how long the death camera ignores shoulder button inputs and keeps turning towards the killer
dead camera minimum falling velocity#minimum velocity to switch to fell to death behavior (when biped is not actually falling to death)
maximum boost speed#the scaling factor for the left stick when the left trigger is fully depressed
time to maximum_boost#seconds. while pegging boost, time to reach maximum speed
zoomed field of view:degrees#field of view when zoomed
zoomed look speed#scaling factor for look speed when zoomed
bounding sphere radius:wu#radius of sphere for collision
flying cam movement delay:seconds#how quickly the camera responds to the user's input
zoom transition time:seconds#how long it takes to zoom in or out
vertical movement time to max speed
survival switch time:seconds#how long it takes in survival mode before switching to flying camera
minimum distance:wu
maximum distance:wu
orbit cam movement delay:seconds#how quickly the camera responds to the user's input
orbit cam z offset:wu#how far above the object's root node to position the camera's focus point
orbit cam minimum elevation:radians#lowest angle the camera can be moved to
orbit cam maximum elevation:radians#highest angle the camera can be moved to
max playback speed#how fast the film plays when the trigger is fully depressed
fade out time:seconds#how long it takes for the screen to fade out when rewinding
fade in time:seconds#see above
enter vehicle transition time:seconds#how long it takes the camera to move from first to third person when entering a vehicle
exit vehicle transition time:seconds#see above

_field_real_fraction.name: cylinder fraction#controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

_field_angle.name: obstruction test angle:degrees#how wide of a cone to test

_field_real.name: obstruction max inward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision
obstruction max outward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current
obstruction max velocity:1.0/s#maximum speed the camera can move
obstruction return delay:s#when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so
axial dead zone
radial dead zone

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_real_fraction.name: magnetism friction#how much the crosshair slows over enemies
magnetism adhesion#how much the crosshair sticks to enemies
inconsequential target scale#scales magnetism level for inconsequential targets like infection forms

_field_real_point_2d.name: crosshair location#-1..1, 0 is middle of the screen

_field_real.name: fireteam command mode duration:seconds#How long is command mode on after you initially attempt to issue an order
look autolevelling scale#1 is fast, 0 is none, >1 will probably be really fast
gravity_scale

_field_short_integer.name: minimum autolevelling ticks#amount of time player needs to move and not look up or down for autolevelling to kick in

_field_angle.name: minimum angle for vehicle flipping#0 means the vehicle's up vector is along the ground, 90 means the up vector is pointing straight up:degrees

_field_explanation.name: weapons may optionally be set to require extra button hold time (e.g. ordnance power weapon drops)

_field_real.name: minimum action hold time:seconds#time that player needs to press ACTION to register as a HOLD
minimum action hold time for teammates:seconds#teammates of player who dropped/spawned weapon
minimum action hold time for opponents:seconds#opponents of player who dropped/spawned weapon
pegged zoom supression threshold#for spinny-shotgun goodness
minimum vertical velocity:wu/s
cooldown time:seconds
throw channel width#how close to an axis you have to be
throw peg threshold#how far from the center you have to be
throw centered min time:s#how long the stick must be centered to start a throw
throw drawing max time:s#how long you can take to become pegged at the start of a throw
throw drawn max time:s#how long you can stay pegged at the start of a throw
throw throwing max time:s#how long you can take to throw the stick to pegged on the other side
flick peg jump max time:s#max time you can be pegged and then press jump to activate
double tap interval time:s#to engage double-tap, user must press jump twice in this much time

normal friend damage#friend damage multiplier on normal difficulty

_field_block._field_explanation: difficulty-affecting values for enemy ranged combat settings

_field_real.name: easy rate of fire#enemy rate of fire scale on easy difficulty
normal rate of fire#enemy rate of fire scale on normal difficulty
hard rate of fire#enemy rate of fire scale on hard difficulty
imposs. rate of fire#enemy rate of fire scale on impossible difficulty
easy projectile error#enemy projectile error scale, as a fraction of their base firing error. on easy difficulty
normal projectile error#enemy projectile error scale, as a fraction of their base firing error. on normal difficulty
hard projectile error#enemy projectile error scale, as a fraction of their base firing error. on hard difficulty
imposs. projectile error#enemy projectile error scale, as a fraction of their base firing error. on impossible difficulty
easy burst error#enemy burst error scale; reduces intra-burst shot distance. on easy difficulty
normal burst error#enemy burst error scale; reduces intra-burst shot distance. on normal difficulty
hard burst error#enemy burst error scale; reduces intra-burst shot distance. on hard difficulty
imposs. burst error#enemy burst error scale; reduces intra-burst shot distance. on impossible difficulty
easy new target delay#enemy new-target delay scale factor. on easy difficulty
normal new target delay#enemy new-target delay scale factor. on normal difficulty
hard new target delay#enemy new-target delay scale factor. on hard difficulty
imposs. new target delay#enemy new-target delay scale factor. on impossible difficulty
easy burst separation#delay time between bursts scale factor for enemies. on easy difficulty
normal burst separation#delay time between bursts scale factor for enemies. on normal difficulty
hard burst separation#delay time between bursts scale factor for enemies. on hard difficulty
imposs. burst separation#delay time between bursts scale factor for enemies. on impossible difficulty
easy target tracking#additional target tracking fraction for enemies. on easy difficulty
normal target tracking#additional target tracking fraction for enemies. on normal difficulty
hard target tracking#additional target tracking fraction for enemies. on hard difficulty
imposs. target tracking#additional target tracking fraction for enemies. on impossible difficulty
easy target leading#additional target leading fraction for enemies. on easy difficulty
normal target leading#additional target leading fraction for enemies. on normal difficulty
hard target leading#additional target leading fraction for enemies. on hard difficulty
imposs. target leading#additional target leading fraction for enemies. on impossible difficulty
easy overcharge chance#overcharge chance scale factor for enemies. on easy difficulty
normal overcharge chance#overcharge chance scale factor for enemies. on normal difficulty
hard overcharge chance#overcharge chance scale factor for enemies. on hard difficulty
imposs. overcharge chance#overcharge chance scale factor for enemies. on impossible difficulty
easy special fire delay#delay between special-fire shots (overcharge, banshee bombs) scale factor for enemies. on easy difficulty
normal special fire delay#delay between special-fire shots (overcharge, banshee bombs) scale factor for enemies. on normal difficulty
hard special fire delay#delay between special-fire shots (overcharge, banshee bombs) scale factor for enemies. on hard difficulty
imposs. special fire delay#delay between special-fire shots (overcharge, banshee bombs) scale factor for enemies. on impossible difficulty
easy guidance vs player#guidance velocity scale factor for all projectiles targeted on a player. on easy difficulty
normal guidance vs player#guidance velocity scale factor for all projectiles targeted on a player. on normal difficulty
hard guidance vs player#guidance velocity scale factor for all projectiles targeted on a player. on hard difficulty
imposs. guidance vs player#guidance velocity scale factor for all projectiles targeted on a player. on impossible difficulty
easy melee delay base#delay period added to all melee attacks, even when berserk. on easy difficulty
normal melee delay base#delay period added to all melee attacks, even when berserk. on normal difficulty
hard melee delay base#delay period added to all melee attacks, even when berserk. on hard difficulty
imposs. melee delay base#delay period added to all melee attacks, even when berserk. on impossible difficulty
easy melee delay scale#multiplier for all existing non-berserk melee delay times. on easy difficulty
normal melee delay scale#multiplier for all existing non-berserk melee delay times. on normal difficulty
hard melee delay scale#multiplier for all existing non-berserk melee delay times. on hard difficulty
imposs. melee delay scale#multiplier for all existing non-berserk melee delay times. on impossible difficulty

_field_block._field_explanation: difficulty-affecting values for enemy grenade behavior

_field_real.name: easy grenade chance scale#scale factor affecting the desicions to throw a grenade. on easy difficulty
normal grenade chance scale#scale factor affecting the desicions to throw a grenade. on normal difficulty
hard grenade chance scale#scale factor affecting the desicions to throw a grenade. on hard difficulty
imposs. grenade chance scale#scale factor affecting the desicions to throw a grenade. on impossible difficulty
easy grenade timer scale#scale factor affecting the delay period between grenades thrown from the same encounter (lower is more often). on easy difficulty
normal grenade timer scale#scale factor affecting the delay period between grenades thrown from the same encounter (lower is more often). on normal difficulty
hard grenade timer scale#scale factor affecting the delay period between grenades thrown from the same encounter (lower is more often). on hard difficulty
imposs. grenade timer scale#scale factor affecting the delay period between grenades thrown from the same encounter (lower is more often). on impossible difficulty

_field_block._field_explanation: difficulty-affecting values for enemy placement

_field_real.name: easy major upgrade (normal)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant. on easy difficulty
normal major upgrade (normal)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant. on normal difficulty
hard major upgrade (normal)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant. on hard difficulty
imposs. major upgrade (normal)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant. on impossible difficulty
easy major upgrade (few)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = normal. on easy difficulty
normal major upgrade (few)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = normal. on normal difficulty
hard major upgrade (few)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = normal. on hard difficulty
imposs. major upgrade (few)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = normal. on impossible difficulty
easy major upgrade (many)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = many. on easy difficulty
normal major upgrade (many)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = many. on normal difficulty
hard major upgrade (many)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = many. on hard difficulty
imposs. major upgrade (many)#fraction of actors upgraded to their major variant when mix = many. on impossible difficulty

normal player vehicle ram chance#Chance of deciding to ram the player in a vehicle on normal difficulty
hard player vehicle ram chance#Chance of deciding to ram the player in a vehicle on hard difficulty

hard trick dodge chance scale#Multiplies the chance that a flying vehicle will trick to dodge danger on hard difficulty
imposs. trick dodge chance scale#Multiplies the chance that a flying vehicle will trick to dodge danger on impossible difficulty

full speed multiplier#how much faster we actually go when at full momentum
sprint turn multiplier#how much faster to turn when sprinting
pegged magnitude#how far the stick needs to be pressed before being considered pegged
pegged angular threshold#how far off straight up (in degrees) we consider pegged

_field_angle.name: max look yaw velocity:degrees per second
max look pitch velocity:degrees per second

_field_real.name: minimum player velocity to be considered in a momentum state:world units per second
look window length:seconds#period of time over which we record the biped's look angle for deciding if we should drop him out of momentum
min weapon error#[0, 1] while using this type of momentum, the player's weapon error cannot drop below this value
terminal velocity:wu/s#you die if you fall faster than this (non-multiplayer only)

_field_tag_reference.name: default damage response{damage response}#fall back if none is specified in damage effect tags
friendly fire damage response#anytime your teammate shoots you

_field_real.name: player shield spillover#the minimum amount of shield vitality needed to prevent spillover from damage types that do not spillover.
current damage decay delay:seconds#current damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)
current damage decay time:seconds#amount of time it would take for 100% current damage to decay to 0
current damage decay rate:damage/second#amount of damage that decays from our current damage every second
recent damage decay delay:seconds#recent damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)
recent damage decay time:seconds#amount of time it would take for 100% recent damage to decay to 0
current damage decay delay:seconds#current damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)
current damage decay time:seconds#amount of time it would take for 100% current damage to decay to 0
current damage decay rate:damage/second#amount of damage that decays from our current damage every second
recent damage decay delay:seconds#recent damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)
recent damage decay time:seconds#amount of time it would take for 100% recent damage to decay to 0
current damage decay delay:seconds#current damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)
current damage decay time:seconds#amount of time it would take for 100% current damage to decay to 0
current damage decay rate:damage/second#amount of damage that decays from our current damage every second
recent damage decay delay:seconds#recent damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)
recent damage decay time:seconds#amount of time it would take for 100% recent damage to decay to 0

_field_block.name: shield boost
_field_block._field_explanation: This feature was implemented for the engineer character in atlas. Shield dynamics overrides for when shields are being 'boosted' by an external source

_field_real.name: shield boost decay#amount of shield-boost to decay per second
shield boost recharge time#time to recharge full shields when getting boosted
shield boost stun time#stun time when getting boosted

_field_block.name: materials

_field_explanation.name: when rained on, we report this material

_field_real.name: friction
density:kg/m^3

_field_block._field_explanation: objects of this flotation category have this density relative to being in this material (1.0f==neutral)

_field_real.name: super floater
floater
neutral
sinker
super sinker

_field_tag_reference.name: sound sweetener (melee)#this is a medium sweetener and was the old default

_field_block._field_explanation: when a sweetener inheritance flag is set the sound\effect is not inherited from the parent material. If you leave the sweetener blank and set the flag than no effect\sound will play

_field_explanation.name: when this material is encounted under a material of this type ...
... we report it as this material

_field_real.name: cinematic film aperture
cinematic skip ui up time

_field_fraction_bounds.name: subtitle rect width#percentage towards the center - 0=default, 0.5=center of the screen
subtitle rect height#0=default, 0.5=center of the screen

_field_real.name: style multiplier
difficulty multiplier
difficulty multiplier
transient score time{multi kill window}:s#how long does transient score stay onscreen
EMP kill window#time after taking a guys shields down with emp damage you have to get the emp kill bonus (seconds)

_field_string_id.name: global water material#the default value for what material type water is
global air material#the default value for what material type air is

_field_real.name: biped speed reference:wu/s#for bipeds, the speed at which you are on the far right of the 'speed to max camo' graph
vehicle speed reference:wu/s#for vehicles, the speed at which you are on the far right of the 'speed to max camo' graph

_field_real_fraction.name: camo value for game name#minimum active camo percentage at which a player's game name will start becoming visible

_field_struct.name: camo value to transparency#maps active-camo percentage to alpha for THIRD PERSON rendering
camo value to fp transparency#maps active-camo percentage to alpha for FIRST PERSON rendering

_field_real.name: camo depth bias max distance#This is used to deal with ugly rendering artifacts when camo is not fully on

_field_struct.name: camo depth bias function#This is used to deal with ugly rendering artifacts when camo is not fully on

_field_real.name: grenade throw penalty:0..1#reduces camo value by this much when throwing a grenade
melee penalty:0..1#reduces camo by this much when meleeing
minimum dinged value#when taking damage or doing other actions that reduce camo, we will never drop below this value
interpolation time:s#time it takes to interpolate from 0.0 to 1.0

_field_block.name: garbage collection
_field_block._field_explanation: time before the game considers that following entities as garbage

_field_real.name: Dropped item:seconds
Dropped item by player:seconds
Dropped item in multiplayer:seconds
Broken constraints:seconds
Dead unit:seconds
Dead player:seconds
Dead MP Player:seconds
Dead MP Player overloaded: seconds

_field_long_integer.name: Max dead body count #above this number, overloaded mp time is used to garbage collect dead bodies
